conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway/isometric interior model with extruded walls, visible wall thickness, floor surfaces, and open-top ceiling removal.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and interior volume; proper angled view; clean cutaway. Minor simplification at some wall junctions and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (central living/dining, kitchen to left, bedrooms and baths to right). Some proportional/layout deviations in room widths and a few partitions/openings appear simplified or slightly shifted compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofas, dining table, beds), kitchen and bathroom fixtures included. A few items appear generic and not perfectly aligned to the 2D furniture symbols.

visual_clarity.notes: Good readability of walls/floors/openings; lighting is neutral and does not obscure layout. Minor ambiguity in some door/window detailing due to simplified modeling.

detected_errors.description: Some room proportions/partition placements appear slightly distorted or simplified relative to the 2D plan, especially around smaller rooms/corridor segments.
Door/window placement and/or counts appear approximated; some openings do not clearly match the exact 2D locations/sizes.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with minor-to-moderate deviations in exact proportions and some door/window specifics.
